comment: Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. During deserialization, the relevant JSON objects will then be removed from the parent JSON object, to ensure they are not re-processed.
codesample:
%REM
The following code is in sample1 of deser-50.txt. When processing the firstName label in the JSON object, the JsonSetterConverter will be used to call the setName sub, passing the current value (the first name) as the first parameter and the lastName, a sibling of the firstName element in the JSON object, as the second parameter.
%END REM
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject  &apos;populate accordingly
Dim converter as New JsonSetterConverter
Dim mainHolder as New Person()
Call converter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;).withValueParam().withSiblingParam(&quot;lastName&quot;)
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;, converter)
Call converter.deserialize(mainHolder, jsonObj)
commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. During deserialization, the relevant JSON objects will then be removed from the parent JSON object, to ensure they are not re-processed.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

During deserialization, the relevant JSON objects will then be removed from the parent JSON object, to ensure they are not re-processed.

methods.label: withSiblingParam
methods.comment: Fluent method to retrieve a parameter value fr the setter from the JSON object, or a default value to use if the label is not in the JSON object. The relevant value is passed as the nth parameter to pass to the relevant setter.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is in sample1 of deser-50.txt. When processing the firstName label in the JSON object, the JsonSetterConverter will be used to call the setName sub, passing the current value (the first name) as the first parameter and the lastName, a sibling of the firstName element in the JSON object, as the second parameter.
%END REM
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject  &apos;populate accordingly
Dim converter as New JsonSetterConverter
Dim mainHolder as New Person()
Call converter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;).withValueParam().withSiblingParam(&quot;lastName&quot;, &quot;&quot;)
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;, converter)
Call converter.deserialize(mainHolder, jsonObj)
methods.signature: Function withSiblingParam(labelName As String, defaultValue As Variant) As JsonSetterConverter

The relevant value is passed as the nth parameter to pass to the relevant setter.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

methods.label: withValueParam
methods.comment:
Uses the scalar value of the JSON element the converter is associated with.
The value will be added to the end of the params array, as the nth parameter to pass to the relevant setter.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is from deser-50.txt. It deserializes a JSON object that contains firstName and lastName properties. During the deserialization it calls Laureate.setName(firstName as String, lastName as String). To do this, it uses a JsonSetterConverter tied to the firstName property, so withValueParam picks up that property.
%END REM
Dim json as String
Dim helper as new JsonConversionHelper()
Dim setterConverter as New JsonSetterConverter()
Dim json as |{&quot;firstname&quot;:&quot;Guglielmo&quot;, &quot;surname&quot;:&quot;Marconi&quot;, &quot;share&quot;: 2}|
Call setterConverter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;)._
    withValueParam()._
    withSiblingParam(&quot;surname&quot;, &quot;&quot;)
Call helper.withCustomCnverter(&quot;firstName&quot;, setterConverter)
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Uses the scalar value of the JSON element the converter is associated with.&lt;br /&gt;The value will be added to the end of the params array, as the nth parameter to pass to the relevant setter.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Uses the scalar value of the JSON element the converter is associated with.&lt;br /&gt;The value will be added to the end of the params array, as the nth parameter to pass to the relevant setter.
methods.inlinecomment:
&apos; Uses the scalar value of the JSON element the converter is associated with.
The value will be added to the end of the params array, as the nth parameter to pass to the relevant setter.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;The following code is from deser-50.txt. It deserializes a JSON object that contains firstName and lastName properties. During the deserialization it calls Laureate.setName(firstName as String, lastName as String). To do this, it uses a JsonSetterConverter tied to the firstName property, so withValueParam picks up that property.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim json as String&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as new JsonConversionHelper()&lt;br /&gt;Dim setterConverter as New JsonSetterConverter()&lt;br /&gt;Dim json as |{&quot;firstname&quot;:&quot;Guglielmo&quot;, &quot;surname&quot;:&quot;Marconi&quot;, &quot;share&quot;: 2}|&lt;br /&gt;Call setterConverter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;)._&lt;br /&gt;    withValueParam()._&lt;br /&gt;    withSiblingParam(&quot;surname&quot;, &quot;&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.withCustomCnverter(&quot;firstName&quot;, setterConverter)
